00050     template<class T1, class P1, template<typename> class S1,
00051              class T2, class P2, template<typename> class S2>
00052     void copyMatrix(Matrix<T1,P1,S1>& A, const Matrix<T2,P2,S2>& M) {
00053       uint m = M.rows();
00054       uint n = M.cols();
00055       Matrix<T1,P1,S1> B(m, n);
00056 
00057       for (uint j=0; j<m; ++j)
00058         for (uint i=0; i<n; ++i)
00059           B(j,i) = M(j, i);
00060 
00061       A = B;
00062     }
00063 
00065     // matrix's sparseness...
00072     template<class T1, class P1, class T2, class P2>
00073     void copyMatrix(Matrix<T1,P1,SparseArray>& A, const Matrix<T2,P2,SparseArray>& M) {
00074       uint m = M.rows();
00075       uint n = M.cols();
00076       static T2 null_value;
00077       Matrix<T1,P1,SparseArray> B(m, n);
00078 
00079       for (uint j=0; j<m; ++j)
00080         for (uint i=0; i<n; ++i) {
00081           T2 t = M(j, i);
00082           if (t != null_value)
00083             B(j, i) = t;
00084         }
00085       A = B;
00086     }
00087 
00088     template<typename T, template<typename> class S>
00089     Matrix<T, RowMajor, S> reinterpretOrder(const Matrix<T, ColMajor, S>& A) {
00090       Matrix<T, RowMajor, S> result(A.rows(), A.cols());
00091       result.set(A);
00092       return(result);
00093     };
00094 
00095     template<typename T, template<typename> class S>
00096     Matrix<T, ColMajor, S> reinterpretOrder(const Matrix<T, RowMajor, S>& A) {
00097       Matrix<T, ColMajor, S> result(A.rows(), A.cols());
00098       result.set(A);
00099       return(result);
00100     };

00103     // These are left as templated functions in case we need to
00104     // specialize them in the future for performance reasons...
00105 
00107     template<typename T, class P, template<typename> class S>
00108     std::vector<T> getRow(const Matrix<T,P,S>& M, const uint j) {
00109       uint n = M.cols();
00110       std::vector<T> row(n);
00111       for (uint i=0; i<n; ++i)
00112         row[i] = M(j,i);
00113 
00114       return(row);
00115     }
00116 
00117 
00119     template<typename T, class P, template<typename> class S>
00120     std::vector<T> getCol(const Matrix<T,P,S>& M, const uint i) {
00121       uint m = M.rows();
00122       std::vector<T> col(m);
00123       for (uint j=0; j<m; ++j)
00124         col[j] = M(j,i);
00125 
00126       return(col);
00127     }
00128 
00129   }
